DataElement.preferredName: Radical Prostatectomy Prostate Gland Positive Surgical Margin Patient Orientation java.lang.String
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Surgery to remove the entire prostate. The two types of radical prostatectomy are retropubic prostatectomy and perineal prostatectomy.:The walnut shaped accessory sex gland of the male reproductive system.  It is located in the pelvis just below the bladder, surrounding the prostatic part of the urethra.  The prostate gland secretes a fluid which is part of the semen.:definition pending_A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.:Position or alignment relative to points of the compass or other specific directions._Generic value domain for a java datatype that is a class that represents character strings.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Radical Prostatectomy Prostate Gland Positive Surgical Margin
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Surgery to remove the entire prostate. The two types of radical prostatectomy are retropubic prostatectomy and perineal prostatectomy.:The walnut shaped accessory sex gland of the male reproductive system. Concepts.definition: The surgical removal of all of the prostate as well as some surrounding tissue, including lymph nodes.

The walnut shaped accessory sex gland of the male reproductive system. It is located in the pelvis just below the bladder, surrounding the prostatic part of the urethra. The prostate gland secretes a fluid which is part of the semen.
Indicates the presence of tumor cells at the edge of a surgically excised specimen.
